Module org.microbean.interceptor
Package org.microbean.interceptor

Class Chain

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.interceptor.Chain
All Implemented Interfaces:
InvocationContext, Cloneable, Callable<Object>
public final class Chain extends Object implements Callable<Object>, Cloneable, InvocationContext
A Callable InvocationContext.
Author:
Laird Nelson

      public Chain()
      Creates a new Chain.

  • Method Details

    • sort

      public final Chain sort()
      Returns a Chain whose internal list of InterceptorFunctions is sorted by priority, where the smallest number "wins".
      Returns:
      a Chain
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent but not necessarily deterministic, since two InterceptorFunctions with the same priority may sort to different indices in the relevant list.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      public final Chain withTarget(Object target)
      Returns this Chain with its target already set to the supplied target.
      Parameters:
      target - the new target; may be null
      Returns:
      this Chain
      See Also:
      • getTarget()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • plusInterceptorFunction

      public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup, Method method)
      Returns a Chain that reflects the addition of an InterceptorFunction built from the supplied arguments.
      Parameters:
      lookup - a MethodHandles.Lookup; must not be null
      method - a Method representing an interceptor method; must not be null
      Returns:
      a Chain that reflects the addition of the supplied InterceptorFunction
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if lookup or method is null
      See Also:
      • plusInterceptorFunction(Lookup, Method, Supplier)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • plusInterceptorFunction

      public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup, Method method, Supplier<?> interceptorSupplier)
      Returns a Chain that reflects the addition of an InterceptorFunction built from the supplied arguments.
      Parameters:
      lookup - a MethodHandles.Lookup; must not be null
      method - a Method representing an interceptor method; must not be null
      interceptorSupplier - a Supplier of an interceptor on which the supplied method will effectively be invoked; may be null
      Returns:
      a Chain that reflects the addition of the supplied InterceptorFunction
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if lookup or method is null
      See Also:
      • interceptorFunction(Lookup, Method)
      • plusInterceptorFunction(InterceptorFunction, Supplier)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • plusInterceptorFunction

      public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(InterceptorFunction function)
      Returns a Chain that reflects the addition of the supplied InterceptorFunction.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • plusInterceptorFunction

      public final Chain plusInterceptorFunction(InterceptorFunction function, Supplier<?> interceptorSupplier)
      Returns a Chain that reflects the addition of the supplied InterceptorFunction.
      Parameters:
      function - the InterceptorFunction; may be null in which case this Chain will be returned
      interceptorSupplier - a Supplier of an interceptor; may be null in which case an appropriate representation of the getTarget() method will be used instead
      Returns:
      a Chain that reflects the addition of the supplied InterceptorFunction
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • size

      public final int size()
      Returns the size of this Chain.

      A Chain's size consists of the sum of the number of its interceptor functions, plus 1 if it is terminated.

      Returns:
      ths size of this Chain; never negative
      See Also:
      • isTerminated()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • intercepts

      public final boolean intercepts()
      Returns true if this Chain has at least one InterceptorFunction and hence will actually perform an interception.
      Returns:
      true if this Chain will perform an interception; false otherwise
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.

      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • prime

      public final Chain prime()
      Primes this Chain by calling Supplier.get() on each of its interceptor suppliers, priming them for subsequent use.

      After an invocation of this method, the isPrimed() method will forever afterwards return true.

      Returns:
      this Chain
      See Also:
      • isPrimed()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • isPrimed

      public final boolean isPrimed()
      Returns true if this Chain is primed.

      A Chain is primed after the prime() method has been called successfully.

      Priming a Chain initializes its interceptor suppliers.

      Returns:
      true if this Chain is primed
      See Also:
      • prime()
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • call

      public final Object call() throws Exception
      Calls the proceed() method and returns its result.
      Specified by:
      call in interface Callable<Object>
      Returns:
      the result of invoking the proceed() method
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs
      See Also:
      • proceed()

    • proceed

      public final Object proceed() throws Exception
      Proceeds to the next interception in the Chain and returns any result.
      Specified by:
      proceed in interface InvocationContext
      Returns:
      any result of the interception
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs
      See Also:
      • InvocationContext.proceed()
      Idempotency:
      No guarantees are made about idempotency or determinism.
      Nullability:
      This method may return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • constructor

      public static final Constructor<?> constructor(MethodHandle mh)
      Invokes MethodHandles.reflectAs(Class, MethodHandle) with Constructor.class and the supplied MethodHandle as arguments, and returns the result.
      Parameters:
      mh - the MethodHandle representing a constructor; must not be null
      Returns:
      a Constructor representing the supplied MethodHandle
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if mh does not represent a constructor
      IllegalArgumentException - if mh is not a direct method handle
      NullPointerException - if mh is null
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • method

      public static final Method method(MethodHandle mh)
      Invokes MethodHandles.reflectAs(Class, MethodHandle) with Method.class and the supplied MethodHandle as arguments, and returns the result.
      Parameters:
      mh - the MethodHandle representing a method; must not be null
      Returns:
      a Method representing the supplied MethodHandle
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if mh does not represent a method
      IllegalArgumentException - if mh is not a direct method handle
      NullPointerException - if mh is null
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

      lookup - a MethodHandles.Lookup; must not be null

    • terminalConstructor

      public static final Function<Object[],Object> terminalConstructor(MethodHandles.Lookup lookup, MethodHandle mh)
      Returns a Function suitable for use as a terminal constructor built from the supplied arguments.
      Parameters:
      lookup - a MethodHandles.Lookup; must not be null
      mh - a MethodHandle representing a constructor or method that will create an object; must not be null
      Returns:
      a Function suitable for use as a terminal constructor built from the supplied arguments
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied MethodHandle's MethodHandle.type() return value has a return type of Void or void
      InterceptorException - if any other error occurs
      See Also:
      • withTerminalConstructor(Function, Supplier)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
